summary_gpt: V-Guard Industries Ltd. announced a board meeting scheduled for May 14, 2025, to review and approve the company's audited financial results for the quarter and year ending March 31, 2025, and to consider recommending a final dividend for FY 2024-25. The company also informed about the trading window closure in compliance with SEBI regulations.

V-Guard Industries received two GST demand orders from the Commercial Tax Officer in Coimbatore, related to non-generation of e-waybills for credit notes issued in FY 2021-22 and FY 2022-23, amounting to approximately ₹52.39 lakh and ₹72 lakh respectively. The company is currently evaluating the next steps in response to these orders.

V-Guard Industries Ltd received two GST demand orders from the Commercial Tax Officer in Coimbatore, related to non-generation of e-waybills for credit notes issued in FY 2019-20 and 2020-21, resulting in a combined financial impact of approximately ₹1.17 crore. The company has disclosed this compliance update as per SEBI regulations, with no indication of additional operational disruptions.

V-Guard Industries received a demand order from the Commercial Tax Officer in Tamil Nadu for non-generation of e-waybills related to FY 2018-19, resulting in a monetary impact of approximately ₹54.94 lakh including tax and penalties. The company has disclosed this regulatory action as per SEBI requirements, with no indication of further operational disruptions.
